string.p: Welcome to SkyAfra App, Nice to meet you!

resources.string: Login if you already have an account.
Register to get started with the app.
Please change the language on your phone to change the language.
Please use portrait mode to register.
Click the Button to Start Scanning
Want to know the types of waste?

Organic waste is waste that comes from the remains of living creatures which is easily decomposed naturally without human intervention to decompose. Organic waste can be said to be environmentally friendly waste and can even be reprocessed into something useful if managed properly. However, if waste is not managed properly it will cause disease and unpleasant odors as a result of the rapid decomposition of organic waste.

Wet organic waste is organic waste that contains a lot of water. Examples of wet organic waste are vegetable waste, banana peels, rotten fruit, onion skins and the like. This is what I said, organic waste can cause an unpleasant odor because of the high water content which causes this type of waste to rot quickly.

Dry organic waste is organic waste that contains little water. Examples of organic waste include wood, tree branches, wood and dry leaves. Most organic waste is difficult to reprocess so it is more often burned to destroy it.
1. Organic Waste for Compost / Organic Fertilizer
4. Can be used as biogas and electricity

Inorganic waste is waste produced from non-biological materials, non-renewable natural resources, and the results of technological processes for managing mining and industrial materials. Inorganic waste buried in the ground can cause soil pollution because inorganic waste is classified as a substance that is difficult to decompose and the waste will be buried in the soil for a long time, this causes damage to the soil layer.

Waste that is soft or flexible and easy to shape. For example, plastic, synthetic cork or styrofoam, plastic straws, and fast food wrappers. Apart from that, waste is in the form of liquids such as detergent water, washing soap, used cooking oil, and others.

It is not easily destroyed. Usually, inorganic hard waste will be destroyed by certain methods, heating or burning. Examples of rubbish or inorganic hard waste are broken ceramics, glass, rusty nails and used cans.
The benefit of inorganic waste that we can use is by making crafts from this rubbish/waste. For example, plastic waste can be made into bags, dining tablecloths, knick-knacks.
1. Ken Anargya Alkausar (C004D4KY0771) - Cloud Computing - Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember

SkyAfra - An App to Help People Sort Their WasteBiodegradable waste management has become an important concern in the context of sustainable waste management and environmental conservation recent advances in technology for detecting biodegradable waste in various environments. with identifying and separating biodegradable waste from other waste streams. It then explores emerging technological solutions to overcome these challenges, including computer vision-based systems, artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms, and machine learning (ML) techniques.
